channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023110940
item.description:
Report X-2023110940

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-12
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Haz- Mat was found in trailer. Employee noticed package had been leaking out from the bottom of container. Removed the package from trailer and, then notified manager who then called QA. when QA arrived we placed leaking package into a red tote with hazmat bag. and cleaned up area with proper precautions. DescribePack: Upon inspection of the container noticed the seam of the container was leaking. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Certified admin made sure they had the proper hazmat apparel on to handle the leaking package.

item.title: Report X-2023110388
item.description:
Report X-2023110388

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER OBSERVED WET CARTON ON NORTH DOCK CATWALK. CARTON WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP WORK AREA FOR INSPECTION. RESPONDER OBSERVED LOOSE/DEFECTIVE CAPS ON PLASTIC BOTTLES INSIDE OF CARTON. PH TAPE READING WAS 0. CONTENTS WERE PROCESSED FOLLOWING DMP/DMN PROCEDURES WITHOUT INCIDENT.

item.title: Report X-2023110361
item.description:
Report X-2023110361

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED/DISTREESED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A SOUR ODOR BY A PRIMARY SORTER IN SECTION-B. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND DONNING PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE VENT/AUXILARY CAP ON A 5-GAL CLOSED HEAD POLY PAIL WAS LOOSE BY A FULL ROTATION, CAUSING 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BASE OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 48 LBS/SQ IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2023110360
item.description:
Report X-2023110360

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES. THE RESPONDER DONNED THE PROPER PPE AND FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND THE PACKAGE COULD BE TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE INNER CONTAINERS EACH HAD LOOSE CAPS BY 1/4 TURN AND APPROXIMATELY 3 OUNCES HAD LEAKED FROM 3 OF THE FOUR GALLON JUGS. THERE WAS A FIBERBOARD PARTITION SURROUNDING THE UPPER SECION OF THE BOTTLES AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALLED FIBERBOARD BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023110344
item.description:
Report X-2023110344

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE SOUND OF DRY ICE ROLLING AROUND IN THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED LESS THAN ONE POUND OF DRY PELLETS COOLING MEAT. OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED PERISHABLE WITH UP ARROWS AND REFRIGERATE UPON ARRIVAL. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023110603
item.description:
Report X-2023110603

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-28
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on our loading dock leaking. The manager called it out to our QA. The QA admin then placed the Hazmat into a lined tote and placed it inside the Haz cage for inspection. DescribePack: The package contains four 1-gallon bottles of Zep stain remover. One of the bottles had the lid come loose causing it to almost completely empty out into the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged item was placed inside a lined drum along with the damaged package. The undamaged items have been repacked to be RTS.

item.title: Report X-2023110002
item.description:
Report X-2023110002

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/13/2023 at approximately 1945, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5608001 at the station location in St. Louis, reporting an undeclared corrosive spill. The shipment consists of 8 fiberboard boxes. 1 fiberboard box was observed damaged due to wetness. Further investigation revealed there were two boxes inside marked with "UN 3265, Corrosive liquid, acidic, organic n.o.s. (Urea Sulfate)" and labeled with Class 8 hazard label. Eack of the inner boxes contained 4 plastic containers, identified as "multi-purpose degreaser". The outer package was not prepared per IATA Regulations. It is undetermined if the 7 other mps shipments were identical since they moved forward in transport before the discovery. The damaged package is being held, pending an investigation from the FAA.
